page.title: 04Farming
page.content: A Livery of 30 horses and a Riding School have been established on one of the D-K Farms at Lane End.This is an alternative use of land as the EEC is encouraging farmers not to grow so much food.3 of the horses which the children of the Suter Family at Church Farm used to ride are now retained for the use of young disabled riders. Only Downley Farm fattens up piglets for pork production. Church Farm has 1000 free-range hens,mostly hybrid which produce a brown shelled egg.They keep a few Light Sussex and some speciality breeds-Black and Buff Orpington and Cochin from Andalusia for interest.Downley Farm's 100 hens are also free-range.Both farms find a ready market for their eggs amongst the local community as they are preferred to those produced by battery hens.
